content: Singaporean army general **Perry Lim Cheng Yeow** [PJG](/wiki/Pingat_Jasa_Gemilang_(Tentera)) [PPA(E) PPA(P)](/wiki/Pingat_Pentadbiran_Awam_(Tentera)) is a Singaporean former [lieutenant-general](/wiki/Lieutenant-general) who served as [Chief of Defence Force](/wiki/Chief_of_Defence_Force_(Singapore)) between 2015 and 2018. ## Education Lim studied at [Raffles Institution](/wiki/Raffles_Institution) and won the [President's Scholarship](/wiki/President%27s_Scholarship) and the [Singapore Armed Forces Overseas Scholarship](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces_Overseas_Scholarship) in 1991. He studied at [Christ's College, Cambridge](/wiki/Christ%27s_College,_Cambridge), where he received a [starred first](/wiki/Starred_first) in [mechanical engineering](/wiki/Mechanical_engineering). In 2008, he won the Lee Kuan Yew Postgraduate Scholarship and went on to study for a [Master of Business Administration](/wiki/Master_of_Business_Administration) at [INSEAD](/wiki/INSEAD)'s Singapore campus. ## Military career Lim enlisted in the SAF in December 1990 and was commissioned as a [Guards](/wiki/Singapore_Guards) officer in August 1991. He served as the Commanding Officer (CO) of the 1st Battalion Singapore Guards from 2003–2005, the Commander of the 7th Singapore Infantry Brigade in 2009, the Commander of the [3rd Division](/wiki/3rd_Division_(Singapore)) from 2011–2013, and the Chief of Staff (General Staff) from 2013–2014. Before he became the Chief of Staff (General Staff), he held the following appointments in the [Ministry of Defence](/wiki/Ministry_of_Defence_(Singapore)) (MINDEF): Head, Joint Plans and Transformation; Branch Head, Defence Policy Office, Joint Operations Department; Deputy Assistant Chief of the General Staff (Operations). He was also the chairman of the executive committee of Singapore's National Day Parade in 2013. Lim completed the Combined Arms Tactics Course conducted by the [British Army](/wiki/British_Army) in [Warminster](/wiki/Warminster) in 1998. He also attended the [United States Army Command and General Staff College](/wiki/United_States_Army_Command_and_General_Staff_College) in [Fort Leavenworth](/wiki/Fort_Leavenworth) between 2001 and 2002. He was promoted to the rank of Brigadier-General on 1 July 2011. Lim succeeded [Ravinder Singh](/wiki/Ravinder_Singh_(general)) as the Chief of Army on 21 March 2014. He was succeeded by [Melvyn Ong](/wiki/Melvyn_Ong) as the Chief of Army on 14 August 2015 and replaced [Ng Chee Meng](/wiki/Ng_Chee_Meng) as the [Chief of Defence Force](/wiki/Chief_of_Defence_Force_(Singapore)) (CDF) on 18 August 2015. Lim was promoted to the rank of Lieutenant General on 1 July 2016. ## Non-military career In addition to his military appointments, Lim was also a member of the Singapore Administrative Service. From 2006 to 2008, he briefly retired from active military service and served as the Director of Higher Education in the [Ministry of Education](/wiki/Ministry_of_Education_(Singapore)), where he was in charge of policies, planning and funding for tertiary and technical education, and regulating private education. Lim joined resource manufacturer [Royal Golden Eagle](/wiki/Royal_Golden_Eagle) as a managing director in January 2019. ## Personal life Lim is married with three children. ## Awards and decorations - PPA(P)](/wiki/Pingat_Pentadbiran_Awam_(Tentera)) - [Long Service Medal (Military)](/wiki/Long_Service_Medal_(Military)_(Singapore)) - [Singapore Armed Forces Long Service and Good Conduct (20 Years) Medal](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces_Long_Service_and_Good_Conduct_(20_Years)_Medal) -
